nodes.text: Got any plans for tomorrow?
I will be going into Caligari to do more research into the various guilds of Sardonia. It is a... hobby of mine.

options.text: Say Something Polite to Please Joel

nodes.text: Have a good time in Sardonia and good luck with your hobby.
I hope that your day off will be equally useful for you.
It's less a matter of luck, and more a matter of being alert to every opportunity.

options.text: Say Something Clever to Help Joel

nodes.text: So... these guilds you are researching... would they happen to be Thieves' Guilds?
Why yes, they would.
Check out the Con Game Guild... The Chief Thief seems like a very likable sort of guy.
I will do that, thank you.
It's kind of you to offer advice, but I already have very specific plans.

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Learn More About Joel

nodes.text: So this research into guilds you are doing - what, do you think they will recruit you after you graduate with a degree in 'Disbarred Bards?' That'll look good on your resume.
It might surprise you to learn that some guilds are very interested in graduates with a degree from this school. It just depends upon the guild.
It might surprise you to learn that some guilds are very interested in graduates with a degree from this school. It just depends upon the guild.
Are you ready for the big Poobah game?
Of course! I am always prepared to make money.
Got anything new for sale?
Indeed, I have two new items could prove useful in dangerous situations.
The first is a Flambe. It is a bottle of flammable liquid that will explode in flames when thrown at a monster. It is most effective against vermin.
The second item I have for sale is a Boom. This is a form of trap that explodes when something brushes up against it. The Boom does a great deal of damage.
Both of these items are good to have when exploring dangerous areas like the Sea Caves. Since they are one shots, so to speak, you might want to pick up several of each.
Got any juicy rumors today?
Caesari is very good at Poobah... but he takes too many chances, particularly when he is upset. And of course, losing any hand upsets him.
I do hope you will join us at the game tonight. Caesari so looks forward to beating you and taking your money.
We'll see about that.
What do you know about the Sea Caves?
The Sea Caves are an extensive set of underground passageways, waterways, and caverns. It is extremely dangerous - there are many nasty things that crawl and hunt down there.
There is supposed to be pirate treasure hidden there, but the Sea Caves are massive. It would be very easy to get lost.
I am not a fan of the things that lurk in the Sea Caves. Besides, it is wet and slimy down there. It would ruin my shoes.

options.text: Ask How to Find the Sea Caves

nodes.text: So is there some way I can get to the sea caves from here?
You do not know yet? It is supposed to be kept a secret. It would be very bad if someone like Terk found out about it.
Of course, I know this secret will be safe with you, since we are such good friends. And I will not even charge you for it, if you truly wish to know.
I'm listening.

Do you know the secret door from the Hall of Heroes that leads to the Dark Passage? Almost directly across from the Hall of Heroes secret door, you will find one that opens to a staircase leading down to the Sea Caves.
And because we are such very good friends, I will even tell you how to open the secret door, if you truly wish to know.

options.text: Ask About Opening the Secret Door

nodes.text: If you rotate the shield upon the wall, it will reveal a keyhole. It is a trivial matter to pick that lock when one is a skilled rogue.
Thanks, but I'll get it on my own.
As you wish. But do remember that I offered.
Of course, finding the secret door is the easy part. Getting it open, well, it is more difficult. For that information, it will cost you a mere five Lyra.
Okay... here's your money. Now how do I open the secret door?
If you rotate the shield upon the wall, it will reveal a keyhole. It is a trivial matter to pick that lock when one is a skilled rogue.
I think I'll try to figure that out for myself, thanks.
That is, of course, the best way. Good luck with it.
Of course, finding the secret door is the easy part. Getting it open, well, it is more difficult. For that information, it will cost you a mere five Lyra.
No thanks.

However, if you really want to know a way to the Sea Caves and you are willing to, say, compensate me ten Lyra for the information, I could be persuaded to let you know the secret way to the Sea Caves.

options.text: Pay Ten Lyra to Learn the Secret Way to the Sea Caves

nodes.text: All right... here's ten Lyra. Now how do I find the Sea Caves?

Do you know the secret door from the Hall of Heroes that leads to the Dark Passage? Almost directly across from the Hall of Heroes secret door, you will find one that opens to a staircase leading down to the Sea Caves.

nodes.name: Sea Cave Entrance
nodes.description: There's a secret door from the Dark Passage next to the Hall of Heroes that leads to the Sea Caves - I can get out of the school!

nodes.text: Of course, finding the secret door is the easy part. Getting it open, well, it is more difficult. For that information, it will cost you a mere five Lyra.
Okay... here's your money. Now how do I open the secret door?
If you rotate the shield upon the wall, it will reveal a keyhole. It is a trivial matter to pick that lock when one is a skilled rogue.
I think I'll try to figure that out for myself, thanks.
That is, of course, the best way. Good luck with it.
I wouldn't want you to have to spill a secret. I'll just look for it myself.
Good luck with that. Of course, if you do not discover the secret door, I am always glad to be of service.
Maybe some other time.
You know where to find me.
This island was once the port of call for many a pirate ship. There are secluded coves all around the island. It is said that the pirates used the Sea Caves to hide their ill-gotten booty.
It is also said that the Sea Caves are haunted by all the restless dead pirates who died from greed for gold, and now seek vengeance upon the living.
All in all, it seems that the Sea Caves are a most unpleasant and dangerous place to explore.
Bye for now.
I hope to see you later at the Poobah game.
